duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage the Controllers department, overseeing Financial Statement preparation, Payroll, Audit, Tax, Treasury, and Business Affairs Functions.
Provide financial information and expertise to the Management Team and Key Stakeholders.
Oversee the Corporate Accounting Department for accurate and timely dissemination of financial management reports.
Manage the relationship with the company’s external Tax and Audit advisors.
Supervise aspects of the Financial Director’s Functions centered on Treasury, Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable functions.
Manage the payroll process ensuring accurate calculations and payments to employees.
Responsible for Treasury functions including cash control and bank reconciliations.
Establish and maintain systems and controls to verify the integrity of all systems, processes, and data.
Create safeguards to minimize errors and improve efficiency in the Accounts Payable process.
Manage the Company’s Investment portfolio, create strategies, make recommendations to CEO, and manage tax and accounting aspects of investments.
Take charge of the Business Affairs area ensuring regulatory compliance in the areas of business registrations, licenses, and tax.
Perform ad-hoc analysis and projects, creating management reports to help the company better understand & summarize transactional activity.
Play a lead role in special projects and enhancements, including the upgrading of systems and processes.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance required. MBA / CPA certification preferred.
Expert level Microsoft Excel skills, ERP experience preferred.
Knowledge of ADP payroll & QuickBooks software.
